intro: Rhexia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá rhexia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in high-altitude grasslands and cloud forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Rhexia bogotensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
